paper.title: The Stable Semantics and its Variants: A Comparison of Recent Approaches

author.org: Graduiertenkolleg Kognition and German Research Center for AI (DFKI)

paper.venue: KI '94 Proceedings of the 18th Annual German Conference on Artificial Intelligence: Advances in Artificial Intelligence
paper.abstract: The stable and the well-founded semantics are among the leading semantics for logic programs. While stable models do not always exist (and therefore no meaningful inferences can be drawn), the (three-valued) well-founded model is always defined. A weakness of WFS on the other hand is its inability to allow for reasoning-by-cases.
